content:
The Denver Philharmonic Orchestra's Family Concerts series is a fantastic way to introduce kids to classical music in a fun and engaging way.

I've checked their upcoming schedule, and they have a few performances that might interest Emma:

1. **"Peter and the Wolf"**: This classic tale is a great introduction to classical music, and it features a prominent piano part. The DPO will perform this beloved work on [insert date and time] at the Boettcher Concert Hall.
2. **"Musical Storytime"**: This concert is designed for younger kids (ages 3-6) and features interactive storytelling through music. The performance will include piano accompaniment and might feature some fun, kid-friendly piano pieces. The next "Musical Storytime" concert is scheduled for [insert date and time] at the McNichols Civic Center Building.
3. **"Young Artist Showcase"**: This concert features talented young musicians from the Denver area, including pianists. It's a great opportunity for Emma to see kids her age performing classical music. The next "Young Artist Showcase" concert is scheduled for [insert date and time] at the Boettcher Concert Hall.
4. **"Rhapsody in Blue"**: This concert features George Gershwin's iconic piece, which prominently features the piano. While it might be more suited for older kids, it's a great opportunity for Emma to experience a classical music masterpiece. The performance is scheduled for [insert date and time] at the Boettcher Concert Hall.

Please note that the schedule is subject to change, so I recommend checking the Denver Philharmonic Orchestra's website or contacting them directly to confirm the dates and times.

Attending one of these concerts will not only expose Emma to live classical music but also provide her with a unique opportunity to see professional musicians perform up close. Who knows, it might even inspire her to continue pursuing her piano lessons and exploring the wonderful world of classical music!
